approvePermission((address,uint256,uint4.details: Entire Permission struct taken as argument for indexers to cache relevant data.Permissions can also be validated just-in-time via approval signatures instead of approval storage.This can be called by anyone after an approval signature has been used for gas optimization.

checkBeforeCalls(uint256,address,address.details: Accessing data only available in execution-phase:      * Manager paused state      * Expiry TIMESTAMP opcode      * Enabled permission contract state      * Enabled paymaster state      * Cosigner and pendingCosigner state

params.expiry: Unix timestamp this permission is valid until.
params.permissionContract: External contract to verify specific permission logic.
params.userOpCosigner: Address of recovered cosigner from cosignature in validation phase.

hashPermission((address,uint256,uint40,b.details: Important that this hash cannot be phished via EIP-191/712 or other method.

isValidSignature(bytes32,bytes).details: Assumes called by CoinbaseSmartWallet where this contract is an owner.All accessed storage must be nested by account address to pass ERC-4337 constraints.

params.authData: Variable data for validating permissioned user operation.
params.userOpHash: Hash of user operation signed by permission signer.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

revokePermission(bytes32).details: Depending on permission contract implementation, permissions can revoke other permissions.

params.permissionHash: hash of the permission to revoke

params.enabled: True if the contract is enabled.

params.newCosigner: Address of new cosigner to rotate to.

params.enabled: True if the contract is enabled.
params.permissionContract: The contract resposible for checking permission logic.

params.addGasSpend: The new setting to add gas spend or not.
params.paymaster: The paymaster contract, potentially spending user assets.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

approvePermission((address,uint256,uint4.notice: Approve a permission to enable its use in user operations.

checkBeforeCalls(uint256,address,address.notice: Check permission constraints not allowed during userOp validation phase as first call in batch.

cosigner().notice: Second-factor signer owned by Coinbase, required to have approval for each userOp.

hashPermission((address,uint256,uint40,b.notice: Hash a Permission struct for signing.

isPermissionApproved(bytes32,address).notice: Track if permissions are approved by accounts via transactions.

isPermissionContractEnabled(address).notice: Track if permission contracts are enabled.

isPermissionRevoked(bytes32,address).notice: Track if permissions are revoked by accounts.

pause().notice: Pause the manager contract from processing any userOps.

pendingCosigner().notice: Pending cosigner for a two-step rotation to limit failed userOps during rotation.

revokePermission(bytes32).notice: Revoke a permission to disable its use indefinitely.

setShouldAddPaymasterGasToTotalSpend(add.notice: Set paymaster should add gas spend or not.

shouldAddPaymasterGasToTotalSpend(addres.notice: Track if a permission contract should account for gas spent by paymaster.

unpause().notice: Unpause the manager contract to enable processing userOps again.
